name: Cavalier King Charles Spaniel
description: Cavalier King Charles Spaniels are sweet, gentle companions with unfortunately serious health concerns. Heart disease affects a majority of the breed, and syringomyelia (a painful brain condition) is common. Insurance is essential for this breed.

healthRisks.notes: Nearly all Cavaliers affected by age 10

recommendedProviders.name: Healthy Paws
cons: May exclude SM if documented early

faqs.question: Why do Cavaliers have so many heart problems?
faqs.answer: Cavaliers have a genetic predisposition to Mitral Valve Disease (MVD). Studies show virtually all Cavaliers develop heart murmurs by age 10, with many showing signs much earlier. It's the leading cause of death in the breed.

faqs.question: What is syringomyelia?
faqs.answer: Syringomyelia is a condition where the skull is too small for the brain, forcing spinal fluid into the spinal cord. It causes severe pain, scratching at the air, and neurological symptoms. Up to 70% of Cavaliers have it to some degree.

faqs.question: Is pet insurance worth it for a Cavalier?
faqs.answer: Absolutely essential. Cavaliers have the highest rates of serious illness among small breeds. Heart treatment can cost $20,000+, and syringomyelia may require MRI ($2,000) and surgery. Insurance is mandatory for this breed.

faqs.question: What annual limit do I need for a Cavalier?
faqs.answer: We recommend unlimited coverage or at least $15,000+ annually. Heart disease and syringomyelia are expensive, ongoing conditions. Low limits will be exhausted quickly.
